page.title: 11Sheep farming in Rhenigidale
page.content: { {WINTER}In winter the stronger sheep are left on the moor and the weak sheep and that years small lambs are fed on the croft or inside sheds for the months of January and February at least. The ones inside are fed and watered twice a day. In the morning with feeding stuff and in the evening with hay. The outside ones are fed on feeding stuff twice a day and they roam about the croft eating what grass is available. The sheep and lambs are regularly fed drenched, dosed and dipped throughout the year.
